revised_title: Anatomy and Development of Stereum hirsutum (Fr.)
tldr: The author investigates the biology of Stereum hirsutum, a common hymenomycete, by cultivating it on various media and observing its growth and development. The fungus forms a dense mycelial cushion that penetrates into the wood, and after several months, develops small hymenophores with typical basidia and basidiospores. The study provides insights into the anatomy and development of this wood-decaying fungus.
